messages.subject: mountaineering
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/7/03 6:49:24 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/7/03 6:49:24 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I couldn't get past the exposure. I always
loved finding ways to climb up a short cliff when we were camping, but I

never liked being where a fall was potentially fatal. >>

Well we always did non-technical mountain climbs, or at least bare minimum
tech stuff. No rock climbing, my dh is not attracted to that. I am however
and have climbed indoors a couple times and once on a short cliff.
Lifes got too many interesting things to try and I just don't have enough
money and time to do them all...maybe when the kids are a bit older.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
